tool_description: Discover and integrate comprehensive movie details effortlessly with our Movie Data API, your gateway to the cinematic universe
name: MoviesVerse
title: MoviesVerse

api_list.name: Get-Born-By-Date
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/get-born-by-date`

Retrieve information about individuals by proving the born date.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/get-born-by-date`

#### Response
The API returns a single object representing an individual information, with the following properties:

- `name` (string): The name of the individual.
- `categories` (array of strings): Categories or professions associated with the individual.
- `birthDate` (string): Notable work or reference related to the individual's birth.
- `imageUrl` (string): URL to the image of the individual.
- `info` (string): Additional information about the individual, such as their background and career.

#### Sample Response
```json
{
  "name": "Elliot Page",
  "categories": ["Actor", "Producer", "Writer"],
  "birthDate": "Juno (2007)",
  "imageUrl": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmNhZmFjM2ItNTlkNi00ZTQ4LTk3NzYtYTgwNTJiMTg4OWQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTM1MjAxMDc3._V1_QL75_UX60_CR0,0,60,60_.jpg",
  "info": "Elliot Page was born in Halifax, Nova Scotia to Martha Philpotts, a teacher, and Dennis Page, a graphic designer. Page wanted to start acting at an early age and attended the Neptune Theater School."
}
```

api_list.name: Get-Most-Popular-Celebrities
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/get-most-popular-celebrities`
Retrieve information about the most popular celebrities.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/get-most-popular-celebrities`

#### Response
The API returns an array of celebrity profiles, where each profile is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the celebrity.
- `name` (string): The name of the celebrity.
- `professions` (array of strings): An array containing the professions of the celebrity.
- `knownFor` (object): Details about the celebrity's notable work.
  - `title` (string): The title of the work the celebrity is known for.
  - `link` (string): URL to the IMDb page of the work.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "image": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2MjcyMDg1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTgwMzQwMDI@._V1_QL75_UX60_CR0,0,60,60_.jpg",
    "name": "Sofía Vergara",
    "professions": ["Actress", "Producer", "Soundtrack"],
    "knownFor": {
      "title": "Hot Pursuit (2015)",
      "link": "https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2967224/?ref_=chtstrm_knf_1"
    }
  }
]
```
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com/get-most-popular-celebrities"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com/get-most-popular-celebrities"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Most-Popular-Movies
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/most-popular-movies`
Retrieve information about the most popular movies.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/most-popular-movies`

#### Response
The API returns an array of most popular movie profiles, where each profile is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `title` (string): The title of the movie.
- `year` (string): The release year of the movie.
- `timeline` (string): Duration of the movie.
- `rating` (string): The rating of the movie.
- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the movie.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "title": "Poor Things",
    "year": "2023",
    "timeline": "2h 21m",
    "rating": "8.4 (75K)",
    "image": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGIyYWMzNjktNDE3MC00YWQyLWEyMmEtN2ZmNzZhZDk3NGJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTUzMTg2ODkz._V1_QL75_UX140_CR0,0,140,207_.jpg"
  }
]
```
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com/most-popular-movies"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Top-Box-Office
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/top-box-office`
Retrieve information about movies currently leading the box office.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/top-box-office`

#### Response
The API returns an array of top box office movie profiles, where each profile is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `title` (string): The title of the movie.
- `posterImage` (string): URL to the poster image associated with the movie.
- `weekendGross` (string): Weekend gross revenue of the movie.
- `totalGross` (string): Total gross revenue of the movie.
- `weeksReleased` (string): Number of weeks the movie has been released.
- `imdbRating` (string): The IMDb rating along with the number of votes.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "title": "Argylle",
    "posterImage": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDM3YTg4MGUtZmUxNi00YmEyLTllNTctNjYyNjZlZGViNmFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTUzMTg2ODkz._V1_QL75_UX140_CR0,7,140,207_.jpg",
    "weekendGross": "$17M",
    "totalGross": "$21M",
    "weeksReleased": "1",
    "imdbRating": "6.0 (16K)"
  }
]
```
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com/top-box-office"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com/top-box-office"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get-Movies-By-Genre
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/get-by-genre`
Retrieve a list of movies by a specific genre.

#### Sample Request
```http
GET /get-by-genre?genre=action
```

#### Response
The API returns an array of movie objects, where each object represents a movie with the following properties:

- `title` (string): The title of the movie.
- `posterImage` (string): URL to the movie's poster image.
- `year` (string): The release year of the movie.
- `timeline` (string): Duration of the movie.
- `description` (string): A brief description of the movie's plot.
- `imdbRating` (string): The IMDb rating along with the number of votes.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "title": "Argylle",
    "posterImage": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDM3YTg4MGUtZmUxNi00YmEyLTllNTctNjYyNjZlZGViNmFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTUzMTg2ODkz._V1_QL75_UX140_CR0,7,140,207_.jpg",
    "year": "2024",
    "timeline": "2h 19m",
    "description": "A reclusive author who writes espionage novels about a secret agent and a global spy syndicate realizes the plot of the new book she's writing starts to mirror real-world events, in real time.",
    "imdbRating": "6.0 (16K)"
  }
]
```

api_list.name: Get-Trending-Trailers
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/get-trending-trailers`

Retrieve trending movie trailers.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/get-trending-trailers`

#### Response
The API returns an array of trending movie trailers, where each trailer is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the movie trailer.
- `trailerLength` (string): Duration of the movie trailer in the format "mm:ss".
- `title` (string): The title of the movie.
- `releaseDate` (string): The release date of the movie (format: Month DD, YYYY).
- `videoLink` (string): URL to the movie trailer on IMDb or another video platform.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "image": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGZjYzE4M2MtNmE5ZC00MjdkLThmYTAtNTAyNjQyN2Q4YmVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_QL75_UX140_CR0,0,140,207_.jpg",
    "trailerLength": "2:26",
    "title": "Deadpool & Wolverine",
    "releaseDate": "July 26, 2024",
    "videoLink": "https://www.imdb.com//title/tt6263850/?ref_=vi_tr_tr_tt_0"
  }
]
```
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com/get-trending-trailers"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Upcoming-TV-Shows
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/upcoming-tv-shows`
Retrieve information about upcoming TV shows.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/upcoming-tv-shows`

#### Response
The API returns an array of upcoming TV show profiles, where each profile is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `title` (string): The title of the upcoming TV show.
- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the TV show.
- `categories` (array of strings): An array containing the categories or genres of the TV show.
- `starring` (array of strings): An array containing the names of the actors starring in the TV show.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "title": "Lover, Stalker, Killer (2024– )",
    "image": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY1NDY0NWItODViZi00MjNlLThmNjUtMDNjZjJhYTg5YjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDg0NjMwNDY@._V1_QL75_UX50_CR0,1,50,74_.jpg",
    "categories": ["Documentary", "Crime", "Short", "Action", "Drama"],
    "starring": [
      "Tony Kava", "Ryan Avis", "Jim Doty", "Chris Maher", "Denise Borraz Trepat",
      "Michael Ursu", "Chloë Julianne Moore", "Denis Reconvald"
    ]
  }
]
```

api_list.name: Upcoming-Movies
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/upcoming-movies`
Retrieve information about upcoming movies.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/upcoming-movies`

#### Response
The API returns an array of upcoming movie profiles, where each profile is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `title` (string): The title of the upcoming movie.
- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the movie.
- `categories` (array of strings): An array containing the categories or genres of the movie.
- `starring` (array of strings): An array containing the names of the actors starring in the movie.

api_list.name: Get-Movie-News
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/get-movie-news`
Retrieve news articles related to movies.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/get-movie-news`

#### Response
The API returns an array of movie news articles, where each article is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the news article.
- `title` (string): The title of the news article.
- `link` (string): URL to the full article.
- `description` (string): A brief description of the news article.
- `date` (string): The publication date of the news article (format: MM/DD/YYYY).
- `writer` (string): The author or writer of the news article.
- `source` (string): The source of the news article.
- `sourceLink` (string): URL to the source of the news article.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "image": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM3YTI0OTAtZTJhOS00YTMzLTk4YTEtZTA2NTUyOTZmNmNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYyNjg2MzUz._V1_QL75_UX140_CR0,1,140,207_.jpg",
    "title": "Bob Odenkirk Reteams With ‘Nobody’ Writer on ‘Normal’",
    "link": "https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/bob-odenkrik-and-nobody-john-wick-writer-reteam-for-normal-1235818901/",
    "description": "Bob Odenkirk is re-teaming with Nobody writer Derek Kolstad on Normal, a crime thriller in which the Better Call Saul star will again take on the unlikely role of action hero...",
    "date": "2/8/2024",
    "writer": "by Scott Roxborough",
    "source": "The Hollywood Reporter - Movie News",
    "sourceLink": "https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/bob-odenkrik-and-nobody-john-wick-writer-reteam-for-normal-1235818901/"
  }
]
```
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com/get-movie-news"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "moviesverse1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get-Celebrities-News
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/get-celebrities-news`
Retrieve news articles related to celebrities.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/get-celebrities-news`

#### Response
The API returns an array of news articles, where each article is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the news article.
- `title` (string): The title of the news article.
- `link` (string): URL to the full article.
- `description` (string): A brief description of the news article.
- `date` (string): The publication date of the news article (format: MM/DD/YYYY).
- `writer` (string): The author or writer of the news article.
- `source` (string): The source of the news article.
- `sourceLink` (string): URL to the source of the news article.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "image": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGU4N2E4ZmItNzYxYy00YWJhLWI5MjgtZDMyNmJlNjk1ZmQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTE0MzQwMjgz._V1_QL75_UX140_CR0,0,140,140_.jpg",
    "title": "Danai Gurira Had Andrew Lincoln Watch ‘Bridgerton’ Before Shooting Their ‘Walking Dead’ Spinoff to Inspire Their Characters’ Love Story",
    "link": "https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/danai-gurira-andrew-lincoln-bridgerton-walking-dead-spinoff-the-ones-who-live-1235819513/",
    "description": "On a Television Critics Association panel earlier this week, Andrew Lincoln teased that he and costar Danai Gurira “watched a lot of Bridgerton” to prepare for their characters’ romance in The Walking Dead: The Ones Who Live...",
    "date": "2/8/2024",
    "writer": "by Kirsten Chuba",
    "source": "The Hollywood Reporter - Movie News",
    "sourceLink": "https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/danai-gurira-andrew-lincoln-bridgerton-walking-dead-spinoff-the-ones-who-live-1235819513/"
  }
]
```

api_list.name: Top-250-Movies
api_list.description:
### Endpoint: `/top-250-movies`
Retrieve information about the top 250 movies.

#### Request
- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `/top-250-movies`

#### Response
The API returns an array of top 250 movie profiles, where each profile is represented by an object with the following properties:

- `title` (string): The title of the movie.
- `year` (string): The release year of the movie.
- `timeline` (string): Duration of the movie.
- `rating` (string): The rating of the movie.
- `image` (string): URL to the image associated with the movie.

#### Sample Response
```json
[
  {
    "title": "The Shawshank Redemption",
    "year": "1994",
    "timeline": "2h 22m",
    "rating": "9.3 (2.9M)",
    "image": "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDE3ODcxYzMtY2YzZC00NmNlLWJiNDMtZDViZWM2MzIxZDYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjAwNDUxODI@._V1_QL75_UX140_CR0,1,140,207_.jpg"
```
